snippet: State Education Secretary Maureen DiMarco, a charter member of Gov. Pete Wilson's Cabinet, resigned last week, after months of feuding with the Governor's aides over policy.    Ms. DiMarco had opposed Proposition 187, which bars illegal immigrants...
lead_paragraph: State Education Secretary Maureen DiMarco, a charter member of Gov. Pete Wilson's Cabinet, resigned last week, after months of feuding with the Governor's aides over policy. Ms. DiMarco had opposed Proposition 187, which bars illegal immigrants from receiving health care, welfare and public school education. The measure was enthusiastically backed by Mr. Wilson and approved by voters in 1994.
abstract: Maureen DiMarco resigned recently as California's secretary of education after months of feuding with Gov Pete Wilson's aides over policy; Wilson has named Marian Bergeson, Orange County supervisor and former member of State Legislature, to succeed her (M)

headline.main: Policy Clashes Doom California School Chief
